website_summaries.verdict: Skip the overpriced single-cup coffee makers and give this inexpensive model a try, which accepts all of your favorite drink pods and capsules.
pros: Comes in multiple colors to match kitchen decor
Makes several cups one after another without needing cool-down period
Smaller size makes it a great choice for work or college
stores easily when space is an issue
Hot drink is ready in about 5 minutes
cons: won’t suit those who want a larger (or taller) coffee
May clog after several uses and stop brewing if not cleaned

customer_reviews.title: Best little pot ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST single K-cup coffee pot I have bought. I have bought the Keurig, Mr Coffee, Hamilton Flex Brew and others, but none of them are as good as this little one. It's small and powerful. The coffee comes out smelling and tasting great every time with no grounds. Takes up very little space on the counter and so easy to use! I am so pleased with this purchase and the price was great as well. I am now thinking of buying another one for the office.
customer_reviews.author: TRACEY CARNEVALE

customer_reviews.title: STOPS WORKING IN LESS THAN A MONTH
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine LESS than 30 days and it is already broken. When we got it, we loved it. Easy to set up, worked wonderfully. We drink a lot of coffee in my house, but there are only 2 of us and we work opposite schedules so this tiny machine seemed like it would be a great fit. And it was. Until yesterday morning when it started to smoke and emit the smell of burnt plastic. Now when we go to make coffee, nothing happens. Could be a great coffee maker, if it worked.....
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Only thing this is good for is a door stop.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work right out of the box. I read on the side of the coffee maker itself and in the instruction manual if light blinks turn it off and wait 2 minutes then turn on again. It still blinked, so I figured I did not wait long enough, I tried again except waited 20 minutes while it was turned off, it still blinked. Returned immediately after that.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Merrick

customer_reviews.title: Exploded my K Cup and shot hot water out of the unit.  Very Dangerous!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Went to use for the first time today. It exploded the k cup and shot hot water and grounds all over my counter. This is total junk and dangerous. Returning it today. Never even got to drink a cup of coffee made by this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim E. Enright

customer_reviews.title: One time purchase ....
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: This is July 20th so basically I got 4 months out of this product before it quit on me. I have tried cleaning it, but is won't use the water in the reservoir and keeps turning off. Very disappointed. The pot actually makes good coffee but if you don't pour in the water slowly and just right, it won't go down and just sits there until you take a spoon and try to move the water through the reservoir. I probably wouldn't purchase again simply for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Simshar

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye Chulux. I will miss you
customer_reviews.text: I got this August 9, 2018 and it quit working November 27, 2018. I will miss my little k cup brewer. It was easy to use and I enjoyed drinking the best tasting coffee in the morning and Earl Grey tea at night. I didn't try to exchange it because it would be too much trouble. I will try another product without the Chulux name to see how it works. Too bad that the k cup brewers have a bad reputation for not lasting very long. Even the name brands have a bad reputation for not working very long.
customer_reviews.author: M. Massey

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after 20 Days
customer_reviews.text: ORIGINAL REVIEW: I bought this product for my office and it has worked out perfectly. Makes coffee as efficiently as the much more expensive Keurig® that it replaced and the small footprint is exactly what I needed for the rather cramped space where it is situated. I highly recommend this coffee maker. UPDATED REVIEW: Twenty days after purchase the Chulux Coffee Maker stopped working (and only used around 10 times). Unfortunately, I discarded the packaging after a couple weeks, so no way I can make a return. Bottom line -- ya get what ya pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eck

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was time for a new Keurig but when I saw the prices I was flabbergasted. Since it's just me and I only need the small pot, I couldn't see shelling out $79+ for Keurig. When I saw the Chulux and the outstanding reviews I decided to take a chance. I wanted the orange color because it was very continental looking. Lo and behold Amazon was having a Father's Day special so I immediately ordered it. This Chulux is simple to operate and makes a fabulous cup of coffee. I haven't experienced any problems with the Chulux. Coffee is hot and flavorable and NO coffee grinds in my cup or in the coffee maker. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mother Crone

customer_reviews.title: Good cup each brew.
customer_reviews.text: Simple functionality and reliable. Slow to brew but convenient. Fills with one cup of water at a time which is not an issue for me. Would purchase again. Consider voting helpful please.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these k cup coffee makers, but could not afford the Keurig brand. This one is great so far! I've had it about a month and I use it several times a day...for coffee, tea and hot chocolate. I love the fun colors too! I purchased the orange one and it goes well with my retro kitchen. Update...I’ve been using this daily for about 9 months, and it’s still working well!
customer_reviews.author: Tam-TamTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: doesn’t last long ... stopped working after 4 months of use . Too bad I really enjoyed using it during those four months . I guess you get what you paid for
customer_reviews.author: Myra N.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in April it is now the beginning of December and the motor/product is going out already. Its started to make a chugging sound, stopping half way when there is water left in the coffee maker. I had to press it 7 times this morning to just fill a cup compared to when I first bought it the coffee would be done in leas than 3 min. With the "CHEAPER" price for a off brand ku-rig I understand, but the darn thing didn't even last a year for me. I even had it put up for 3 months unused.
customer_reviews.author: Tocarra

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I love it but I can’t give it more than 3 stars because it has a design quirk that can be meticulous to keep up with. When using k cups that need punctured (haven’t tried the reusable yet) the dispenser gets jammed in, and the first 1-3 cups of coffee might go well, but bits of coffee grind will make its way into it. Then it gets clogged. So I found a solution, which requires a paper clip, to use to get inside and knock free what you can of the grinds. I don’t know how long it’ll last doing this, but hoping it does well.... Overall not bad, just a little tedious and requires special care.
customer_reviews.author: Yukimi W

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee maker I ever owned !
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these coffee makers for three years. It never fails to deliver ! I decided to order another because when it gets too old to perform ,I want another on hand. For years I used a different brand & had to replace it yearly & it was very expensive. This would be a great unit for a college student or young adult "on his own". I recommend it with no reservations. If you follow the directions for care, it will give you years of service
customer_reviews.author: June McCann

customer_reviews.title: No coffee
customer_reviews.text: If it made coffee it would probably be amazing. Unfortunately mine just makes noises and shuts off. I read the whole instruction manual before I used it. Now I’m rethinking my whole life because I can’t get the simplest coffee maker ever to make me coffee. I returned my last one ☝🏼 in an exchange for a new one. Why not give it another try, right? So this little guy was wonderful for half a year. I got my replacement in July, it didn’t make it past October. It was only used a few times a week so it probably wouldn’t of made it that long with normal use. Lesson learned, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Emubee

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker while it works
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is a simple, small coffee maker. Super easy to use and clean. I was able to make coffee, tea and hot chocolate with no problem. However from a durability standpoint, it didn't last a month before there was tea all over the counter while brewing! I don't know what happened to it, but that happened twice. Now it will not brew at all. I was hopeful with all the great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: lovey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, good features
customer_reviews.text: PROS: +The compact size of this unit was great. It fit perfectly on the counter bar where it wasn't likely to get knocked over. + I like the bright colors this comes in. + Very easy to use. CONS: - The pump on my first one didn't work, and that doesn't seem to be an unusual complaint. - Unit gets VERY hot (top back sides). - Some warping of where the parts come together was present on the broken one. The unit getting very hot caused me to look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: It comes out nice and hot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a simple K-cup coffee maker for myself and my teaching partner to use at school. Was a bit hesitant to buy an off-brand coffee maker, but it does what it's supposed to do. It comes out nice and hot, and the only negatives are that it's hard to fit 16 oz cups - you have to remove the drip tray. There is no way it can handle cups larger than 16 oz. Overall, perfect for what I need it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Camping Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: After years and years of camping coffee this was such a blessing! I love my toffee coffee and missed it when camping. A friend mentioned that they made these and I actually ordered it while I was camping. I got it a few days later and used it the following weekend. It was perfect! Coffee was great! Left it at my camp
customer_reviews.author: M. Fazzio

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in October 2018 - well it’s 3/11/19 and it’s no longer working. Sounds like it heats up the water but than shuts off without dispensing anything. Emptied all water out & tried about 3 times - no coffee. When it works it’s good. Others have asked if all 12 oz dispense, I’d say no some of the water is retained in the internal tubing. I use a measuring cup & it doesn’t dispense the same amount it was filled with. Guessing over time the internal parts are damaged with retained water and that leads to the auto shut off without coffee. Frustrating b/c size is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: cmt975

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing coffee maker. I was looking for a budget coffee maker for a long time and when I saw this one on Amazon.com I was not sure, it didn't look well made. Anyway decided to order it. It works just FANTASTIC. Super easy to start just push the button, you won't miss it there is just one. Which makes everything super easy and simple. This coffee maker boils the water to very hot condition, coffee comes out clear without any peaces, like I saw somebody was posting a picture on here. I make coffee and tea . It's very convenient because it takes just a bit of space. works fast and soundless. I just love it
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: When  it works, it works greaat!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coffee maker for less than a month. It worked fine for the first six cups of coffee. However, I took it with me in my travel trailer to a campground at 7700' altitude. I tried to make a cup of coffee and it failed! The unit heated the coffee, but it would not run it through the pod and into my cup. I tried a couple of pods and it would never run the water into my coffee cup! I'm very disappointed since I had to open a pod and brew coffee in my ceramic percolator coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Lewander

customer_reviews.title: We love the coffee
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this coffeemaker last September. Pros: We love the coffee, the size, the color, the individual choices with K cups. Also relatively inexpensive. Con: It failed today, after working less than four months. We bought it to replace failed Keurigs which lasted longer. Another con: the return window closed one month later after the delivery date (!) and we did not buy multi year protection. We ordered another Chulux today and hope it will last longer. Again I failed to notice the protection option. To me it is peculiar to allow only one month guarantee and then to offer three and four year protection plans. Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this little coffee maker. It was working fine for about 3 weeks and then started leaking out of the bottom where the placement feet are. Leaked ALOT and ruined some important papers nearby. I would not purchase this again. Update- seller notified me this is a know problem so I’m not sure why they are still selling the item without fixing it, but they did refund me. A+ for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Maker Blue Chulux
customer_reviews.text: Works Perfect for me I only drink a cup or two a day (Morning),,, The way the machine works is also perfect for me. I really don't like water sitting in the machine waiting to be used, and the coffee comes out hot and I mean hot around 188 degrees... So far so Good I am very happy with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonflies oo

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and Works Really well
customer_reviews.text: This little machine takes up a tiny bit of space on the counter and works really well. I love the way you pour in the exact amount of water you want to come out and voila!! You have exactly what you need. Makes my morning coffee making a breeze. I never considered getting a pod coffee maker because of all of the plastic the pods are made from, but I found a great new coffee company and the pods are fully compostable, and the coffee is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Clark Browne

customer_reviews.title: Will not last more than a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker 3 times due to the small size and recommendations. It is easy to use and the coffee tastes okay. Best thing is it is so compact. The first one lasted 8 months with twice a day use the second lasted 1 week (refunded) and the third just over a year. Seems to be a design problem in that water will not move through plastic tube after a while. Tried unclogging and cleaning with a special kpod product and still did not work. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: heated up once then never again.  seems it is happening to a lot of people....
customer_reviews.text: The machine heated up 10 oz of water. i came back about 10 mins later attempted to heat a 2nd cup of water in order to "clean" it.... It did not heat the water. So i unplugged it came back 20 mins later tried again. No luck just a flashing light that goes off after a bit and the water still cold, the coffee unbrewed. did the trouble shooting it is clearly not working. My guess is the element failed after the first heat/cool cycle. Maybe just maybe the reason so many people are having units fail so fast is that the element used to heat the water is just cheap and nasty .....
customer_reviews.author: MR Cart

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Machine!
customer_reviews.text: My basic Keurig finally died so I turned to Amazon to find another coffee maker. I wasn't attached to the Keurig name, so that wasn't a problem to try something new. I came across this Chulux. I was a bit doubtful because of the price, but that was actually the selling point. I got it and love it! The size is perfect, and it's even perfect for traveling since many hotels don't have coffee makers in the rooms anymore. My only "complaint" was that the basket to use your own coffee is not a standard one. I recently purchased some online from Chulux, which was cheap enough. Maybe I missed that point in the description, but it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: April Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little backup!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this little brewer! I bought it as a standby backup for my fourth Keurig full size coffeemaker. Past experience with Keurigs tells me that they fail at the most inconvenient times, and they have a rather predictably short life. I didn't know what to expect with the little $39 backup, so seeing it today in person was a very pleasant surprise. Worth every cent of its purchase price. I tested it and then put it in the shelf to wait for its big brother to stop working. I think it would be a perfect gift for a dorm room, or your desk at work. Very sturdy. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Five stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goggans

customer_reviews.title: Am Truly in LOVE with This Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I live alone in a very small condo and counter space is at a premium. When my Keurig died (monstrosity that it was), I searched Amazon and found this wonderful little pod coffeemaker. I use a stemless silicone wine glass I have to add the water (since I'm a klutz and using a mug would result in spillage). I also use refillable coffee pods and they fit and work GREAT in this little powerhouse. If you try to run it without water (my bad), it doesn't overheat - the light just goes off. And, the orange color totally fits my "carousel colors" in my kitchen. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: V. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I usually wait to write reviews so I can give accurate feedback regarding a product after usage. I bought this in January and only used it 3 times on short trips to Vegas. Last weekend on its 4th use, it died. The machine will not turn on to brew coffee. The light simply blinks on and off and will not brew. It is too late to return this item, and I'm very disappointed since it was not a cheap pricetag. Search elsewhere for a travel coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M.

customer_reviews.title: small and functional
customer_reviews.text: *update* 7 months in and it has stopped working. I press the on button, it makes noise like it's heating water, then the light goes off and it doesn't make coffee. Pushing the button again will cause it make more noise like it's heating...but again no coffee. I purchased the chulux k-cop coffee maker because it is small and I have a very small kitchen. It works fine, makes a good cup of coffee and takes up little space. My own complaint is that the water reservoir on top is very shallow so I have to pour the water in slowly or it spills out onto the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Tasty Niblet

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 5 times so far, and it makes a nice cup of coffee. It's easy to use. You need to be careful of pouring in the water... needs a container with a good spout that delivers the water directly into the hole. I was almost out of Melita filters for my 1-cup pour-over, and decided to give this a try... am not disappointed. It doesn't take up a lot of space. **You do need to purchase reusable coffee pods if you will not be using the disposable, pre-filled pods. No grounds go into the coffee as long as you don't overfill the coffee pod and make sure it's shut securely.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: So far I've made 2 cups of coffee and 2 of hot cocoa. The biggest draw back is figuring out the water ratio. Where a true Kurieg will do the adjustment, the Chulux requires you to actually measure the water 12 ounces makes a weaker cup then say 8 or 6 ounces. Other than that, I'm pleased with this purchase, this is not my primary coffee maker, it's for the times I want a single cup or a hot drink in the evenings. This works with most kcups out there. Couldn't rate the durability seeing as how I just received it. Overall very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey cowen

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad coffee maker, especially for the money
customer_reviews.text: This product works well. For the price, you can't beat it. It is a quality coffee maker. Couple of things to point out about it....it takes about 4-5 minutes to make a cup(it's a single cup maker). That's because it takes time to heat the water. I will say when it is done, the coffee is very hot...so the heating system works for sure! The taste isn't the best(I give that a 3.5....but it could also be the coffee pods I'm using too), but it does have a coffee taste nonetheless. I'm glad I made this purchase. I've had a Keurig before this and it didn't taste any better in my opinion and it is 3x the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this item and I must say that i am highly upset that it is no longer working. I received it in January and March 20th it was no longer working. The machine is no longer dispensing water thru the hose into the coffee pod. I was really loving this machine and then poof dead. I understand it is not a Keurig or as pricey as one , but you would expect this to last longer than 2 months. I am assuming amazon or Chullux will not replace or refund me for my cost. But I am letting anyone who thinks about purchasing this to think again.
customer_reviews.author: myra

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Their customer service gets a star this coffee maker doesn't get. It doesn't work, and I've tried twice. The first one wouldn't pump the water up to the k-cup at all. The replacement pumped the water up only once and never again. I followed all the setup, cleaning, and troubleshooting instructions without luck and this one is going back like the one I returned a few weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: ClM

customer_reviews.title: Great until it dies
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. He's loved it. I've snuck in some cups of coffee too. But less than 300 cups and 7 months later, it's dead. I suppose it's still cheaper than Starbucks, which was of course closed for months this year anyway. EDIT: Revising down to one star. Bought a second one that never worked right immediately out of the box and died within a week of use. Unfortunately we received a month or so before using, so return window is closed. Customer support does not respond via email. They'll follow up here with a comment to look responsive, but that's it. You won't hear from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Grolsch

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week.
customer_reviews.text: Only used our Chulux a week or so and it began malfunctioning. (We only put ultra-filtered water in it, no tap water) it will only give you 1/2 cup then it turns off. So leaving the same pod in, we push the button a second time and it cycles the rest of the coffee into the cup. It takes awhile to get the whole cup of coffee going through two cycles. Again, we just bought this machine so I don’t understand needing to clean it already. Not worth my time to try to mail it back, it was a “throwaway” experiment, and this is definitely a throwaway. Back to Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Ranch Girl

customer_reviews.title: Does the same thing the pricier models do
customer_reviews.text: Very compact, simple to use. I liked having a choice of colors and less space used on my counter top. I like my coffee quite strong, so I considered a machine that has a "pulse" option for stronger brew, or offered a larger basket for more grounds, but decided it wasn't really worth the extra cost. This is my third single-cup machine (all different brands), and in my experience none of them last all that long (as compared with a typical drip-brewer). Can't beat this one for the price, and I'm betting it will last longer than my last, most expensive one, did.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cuppa coffee and...
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee and if you buy their separate K cup brew filter for bulk coffee it also works very well. In fact this coffee maker is the first one where the brewing filter for putting your own coffee into ACTUALLY worked well. This coffee maker is very small and takes up very little space on your counter so it is perfect for RVer’s like us or for a small apartment. Time will tell if it will last but so far excellent, and the only reason I don’t give it five stars is because I’ve only had it for a few weeks so not enough time to say that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Zewe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reliability & compact form-factor
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made about 35 cups of tea & coffee in mine so far, without a single mishap or failure. I’ve known of too many Keurig-brand units failing far too soon. Too many controls? Too many bells & whistles? This design is entirely manual; there’s really nothing to go wrong. I always use distilled water, in order to avoid scale. Be sure to use the included filter to protect against coffee grounds from back-flowing into the boiler. It’s quite compact. My only complaint is the name of the brand. I highly recommend this K-Cup beverage maker for its reliability & compact design.
customer_reviews.author: Romaine Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Chulux single server coffee maker for about nine months. It makes very good coffee when it works. However for the last two weeks it has not. I cannot add water the empty reservoir. I tried cleaning the machine with vinegar, but that had no effect. However, after getting instructions from Chukux, I removed the black filter and I ran vinegar through the machine twice and followed by running clear water about one half dozen times.Gradually, the ability of the reservoir to fill improved and now the coffee maker appears to work as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.Shingles

customer_reviews.title: Extremely short durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee maker Oct 15 2018 and made an average of i cup a day. I haven’t even had the coffee maker 3 months and it has stopped working. The coffee maker may be easy to clean, and versatile, but what good is it, if it isn’t durable. I will say, when working, it made a good cup of coffee; however, that didn’t last long. I know you get what you pay for, next time I will pay more and get a well made coffee maker that will be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jo A. Britt

customer_reviews.title: Good small coffee for travel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker as a spare for travel use. I do not like to use coffee makers in hotel rooms that are used by others. Only used a couple of times. It is very compact. If you are used to the speed of a Keurig, you will not have that. It is a very basic coffee maker. You out in enough water for one cup plus the pod, close the top and wait. The coffee was good and hot. My only concern is that people on this site have said that it does not hold up with time. I hope that is not the case. So far it is a good extra.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Great little pot for the office!
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this might be too good to be true, but it has been everything it promised to be. It’s tiny, but it totally gets the job done. I bought it for my office at work. I don’t have a separate place for it, so it has to go on my desk. It’s a large/long counter-style desk, but it would have still been a nuisance with a traditional pot. However this thing is so easy to use and takes virtually no space. I keep a water bottle with filtered water for it, and I have used this pot 8-10 times per week for several months now, and haven’t needed to de-scale. Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Chulux. I was very pleased with the first one I bought, it lasted for over two years. When my first one began to show signs of being on it’s last leg I promptly bought another so I would not be without my coffee. I had only used my new one a handful of times when it stopped working. It would heat the water to boiling but the motor would never kick in and pump the water. I particularly love the size of the Chulux, it is perfect for my small RV, but it seems that it quality of the product is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: RV Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Love... but...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this little machine. We are lovers of coffee, have a Nespresso, but with the economy in the dump, figured we'd go back to single brew that was a little more economical. Ordered this machine, read the instructions (it's an incredibly simplistic machine). The dumb think would not brew a full cup of coffee, it literally heated the water turned off, we turned it on, hit brew and it trickled. We even watched multiple youtube video's because we were convinced we were doing something wrong. The problem isn't us, it's being returned today.
customer_reviews.author: ARNH03064

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I waited to write this review for about a month, to make sure I got proper use if it. Does not disappoint. I have made k cup coffee, loose ground coffee, loose tea, and hot water for tea, and it works perfect every time. For such a small inexpensive coffee maker, it makes great coffee. I make several cups a day and it still works perfectly. I don’t know what size coffee cup some reviewers are using, but every cup I have fits perfectly, and the coffee is nice and hot. I’m super happy to have this product and will buy it as gifts as well. Perfect for small apartments that have no kitchen space.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working two months after purchase! Very dissatisfied, this is the third one I purchased. The first is at my camper which is infrequently used and the second was put in the guest room which is also not used frequently. This one was put in our kitchen and was used daily and only lasted two months. Had purchased the larger model for the kitchen a year ago and that also stopped working after 8-months. Needless to say I will look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Davis

customer_reviews.title: One year later and it leaks!
customer_reviews.text: This little baby was excellent for camping trips. That was my original intent - to leave it in the camper. However, because of ease of use and flavor, I moved it into the house. I normally fix about 2 cups of coffee a day, sometimes just one. I have had it for a year. This week it started leaking. I can't bring myself to give it 5 stars because of this. Even though it is cheaper than the big K, it should last longer than a year. So disappointed. I've heard great things about the company so I'm hoping I can either get this one fixed or get another one. Even if discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Snobs, Keep Scrolling
customer_reviews.text: This review was written by someone who know zero about coffee. With that being said, I bought this to replace our bulky Keurig in our office. I feel the coffee tastes the exact same as if you made it with a $150 machine. It's very easy to use, feels well built and there's little to no clean-up. Takes up very little counter space. It does take a little longer to brew than a Keurig but that doesn't really bother me. Uses the same k-cups as any other machine, just pour in the amount of water you want, pop in a k-cup, push start and enjoy your coffee. What more do you need!
customer_reviews.author: jason sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker But Something You Should Know
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two, one to keep in our emergency closet. The older one quit this morning. It made noise but did not drip water through the pod. We never cleaned it because we only only use bottled water. I tried the vinegar thing to clean it but it didn't work. What I learned was that the tiny water outlet inside top of lid gets plugged with coffee. This little nozzle is the tiny thing that punchers the pod and allows water to flow.. After a i cleaned it out with a needle the pot worked just fine. Bottom line is keep it clean . We love ours !!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this cute little coffee maker when I first bought it, but unfortunately now some of the manufacturing deficiencies are starting to present themselves. There is no marked area to show how much water is in the maker, and the hole to pour water in is extremely tiny. It’s nearly impossible to place water in the machine without splashing it everywhere. It also seems to calcify at the top of the water container because of the way the water pools. I really wanted to love this, and it’s very cute, but it just isn’t something I could recommend after having used it several weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Herman

customer_reviews.title: Big things come in small packages.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little coffee maker, user friendly and works like a charm. Makes a perfect cup everytime. When I first received this item, I noticed that it didn't have a basket for coffee grinds, and asked for a replacement bc I thought it was missing parts. I got the second one and that didn't have one either. Ended up keeping both item bc they are awesome, I would have ordered a different color if I knew that I was keeping both. I ordered the recommended baskets and just waiting for them to come in. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: After hours of searching, FINALLY found reusable filter for this coffee pot!
customer_reviews.text: I think. Search “CHULUX 4-Pack Reusable Mesh Coffee Filter for Single Cup Coffee Maker”. I like this pot because you can brew a 12 oz cup of coffee. I am giving it 3 stars mostly because 1. the spent kcup is a wee bit difficult to remove 2. filling with water can be messy 3. CHULUX makes it very difficult to find correct resuable filter. All standard filters I bought and tried failed because they are approx 2 frustrating centimeters too tall. The supposedly compatible filters in the search text above will arrive in 2 days. I will update review if they work. Keeping my fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Simply Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great price, flavorful taste, easy to use, fast.
customer_reviews.text: The low price and available colors (red) attracted me to Chulux. I have only brewed one cup of coffee using this machine as I just received the shipment. I also ordered fillable K cups for environmental reasons as well as being able to use coffee that I know is fresh. The fillable K cups also afford me a wider variety of flavors. Normally we use the pour-over brewing process with freshly ground beans. This method has all the flavor options of pour-over and is faster, quiet and compact. The last benefit is being able to make individual cups of coffee using different flavors or types and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Villager

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this adorable one cup Keurig type coffee maker to go with the small fridge I bought for a guest bedroom. It’s July 31, 2020 and the machine no longer brews at all. Not hot water, not a coffee pod. I cleaned it, checked for clogs, nothing. It’s done. Kaput. So in the garbage it goes. Cute while it lasted but I also have to add the coffee never was hot the way I feel coffee should be. Disappointed but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Lioness

customer_reviews.title: An unexpected surprise
customer_reviews.text: This Coffee Maker exceeded our expectations. We have a BUNN K cup machine that is longer make that is better than all the rest. Well this inexpensive little gem makes hot coffee and doesn't need to keep a reservoir of water hot which is great for the RV. Very simple to use too. The only caveat is there is a little filter basket where the water gets poured into that makes it unacceptably slow to add water. But I simply removed the filter and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable option for k-cups, but stopped working after a month.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After one month of use this machine no longer brews the full 8oz. I fill with 8oz of water and maybe half comes out now, worse with each use. Pretty disappointing because I really like this machine. New mom, new to drinking coffee daily. Didn't want to spend alot for a higher brand because I wasn't sure how much I'd use it. This is great and used multiple times each day for coffee, cocoa and cider. I love that the instructions are right on the machine. Lots of great colors to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camper coffee
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our camper after a friend recommended hers that she loves. It is the PERFECT size for the tiny amount of counter space I’ve got and since I’m the only one drinking coffee, anything larger or fancier seemed silly. This gets the job done and looks cute doing it!
customer_reviews.author: AmCam

customer_reviews.title: MEASURE YOUR WATER, PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: YOU HAVE TO MEASURE YOUR WATER PERFECT OR ITS NOT GOING TO TASTE GOOD. IT TOOK ME A FEW TIMES TO FINALLY GET IT RIGHT. ITS NOT REALLY A CUP OF COFFEE SIZE, ITS MORE OF AN ESPRESSO SIZE FOR ME. ALSO, IT DOES NOT HAVE. A WATER VIEWER SO YOU CAN SEE THE WATER INSIDE OF THE BREWER. PRETTY EASY AND SIMPLE TO CLEAN, BUT BE CAREFUL WITH THAT SHARP PART. ALSO, WHEN CLEANING BE CAREFUL NOT TO LOOSE THE PARTS. SOME ARE SMALL. I PUT MINE IN A BOWL WITH A LITTLE SOAP.
customer_reviews.author: SAPPHIRE

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over 2 years ago and use if at least 3-5 times per week. So easy to use, and the coffee tastes great. Every couple of months I run a solution of 1/2 regular vinegar (the type you use in salad dressing) and 1/2 water through the machine. Once that is done I run a cup of plain water through it a couple of times just to make sure all traces of the vinegar are gone. Keeps it nice and clean and helps remove any deposits that might build up in the machine. This is a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: tltennessee

customer_reviews.title: A test run in my kitchen worked as good as the big buck/ name coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Another bought, just on others reviews. For the price and my needs, on the road coffee, when Motels/Hotels don't offer room coffee! A test run in my kitchen worked as good as the big buck/ name coffee maker. This will be another test along with the Zento Portable Car Cooling and Warming mini Fridge. I use a DC inverter at rest stops for a quick cup. Sure beats the prices on the Freeways, etc.. A follow up review after my mini fridge trip is planned .
customer_reviews.author: JEPix

customer_reviews.title: Took a chance and glad that I did! Still making good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Have used for almost two years and still making good coffee. I bought to use when I had to travel for surgery; do use at home if I feel like a cup of coffee in evening. Small enough to pack in suitcase, makes quick and good coffee! Uses any maker of pods. I don't use every day. I've only used filtered or bottled water, as instructed. Can also use refillable pod. Cleans up easy, make small or larger cup, you choose the amount of water. I recommend to anyone who wants coffee anywhere they go!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a travel coffee maker. Much smaller and cheaper than the smallest Keurig available. Takes up a reasonable amount of room in my luggage. Overall, I prefer my Keurig, but this does exactly what I purchased it for. I bought the bright orange so less chance of forgetting it in a hotel room. Seems light-weight and plastic-y, but easy to use and makes a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker to replace a Hamilton Beach that lasted only 60 days. Now to my great disappointment my Chulux has only lasted three weeks!!! Quits pumping after about 3 ounces, press the button again and get another 3 ounces, press it a third time to get the full cup. Wow! Never been this disappointed in an appliance. Now on my second one and within one week it started doing the same thing. Only ran about 4 ounces then stopped. Stand there and press the button again to get another 4 or so ounces. Will be returning this one also.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy initially...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for over a year. Initially, I was extremely happy with my purchase. It's small compact. My coffee was ready about a minute. It was great. However, after a year of use. I notice that the water does not get very hot anymore. It was never a piping hot cup of coffee but it was hot. Now after a year, it is almost lukewarm. Very unhappy with the temperature of the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: write2ap

customer_reviews.title: takes a little work at high altitude
customer_reviews.text: This works great at home, 5,000 ft., but for some reason it doesn't pump the entire amount of water at 9000 ft elevation. We start it over again, maybe a couple times and then it finally gives you a cup of good coffee. Now that we understand what we need to succeed with a cup of coffee, it isn't a big deal. We use this little pot in our trailer while camping. We are glad we have it. Works much better than the two or three keurigs we tries.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this product only lasted for a few months. I only had this for about 5 months before it stopped working. This was easy to use and worked wonderfully until out of no where, when I was making myself a cup of coffee, the machine was heating the water for about 4 minutes before I unplugged it. It would slowly trickle out water. Ever since then, it doesn’t properly brewed coffee. Just taken several minutes to trickle our water
customer_reviews.author: Nobrina

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Coffee Maker I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT for travel. Takes only a tiny portion of your bag, even carry-on bag. Able to have GOOD coffee at the hotel for once. Choose whatever K-Cup flavor you like and brew by the cup in your hotel room. No more half-flavored little pods that claim to make two weak cups. You add however much water you want to make strong or weak coffee. ONLY suggestion would be to just make sure you empty it out before packing it in your bag. Makes coffee as good as a big machine but in a compact design. I would DEFINATELY buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Eide

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how much I love this coffee maker. I have a large Keurig. I needed something smaller to replace my smaller coffee maker that died that I use at my grandmother’s. She doesn’t have the counter space for a full size Keurig. I didn’t want to spend the money on the compact Keurig. So I gave this a try. It works great!!! A great value. Makes a great cup of coffee. It’s very easy to use with the pods. I would definitely buy this again!! I will probably be giving this as some Christmas gifts!!! If you’re considering trying it I say go for it!
customer_reviews.author: drj333

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted.  The machine broke down today.
customer_reviews.text: Its performance began suffering about a month ago and today it stopped pumping water through the machine to the coffee mug almost altogether. We only live here half the year so for the price tag of $40 and only working for us for 10 months...might as well get the Keurig-mini for $60. When it worked...it worked great. We weren't sure we would use it so we went on the low-end. Turns out we loved it so we are happily upgrading today.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen A.

customer_reviews.title: vERY DISSAPOINTED IN THIS COFFE E MAKER
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews before buying this for when I go on Vacation. When I got it I tried it with just water which worked well I should have put a coffee pod in it. When I used it on vacation it would not work with the coffee pod in it only a few inches of water came out and it would stop I tried it at least 6 times and still would not work just boiled and boiled away! Should have bought the Keurig small one like I have for coffee at home.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Price

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Pot Ever
customer_reviews.text: Update: purchased another for my mom (blue), per her request. She loves it! This review comes about a year after I've purchased it. But let me just say it is still going strong. I purchased this item to travel with. I purposely chose orange so hotel staff would know immediately that it was mine. My coffee is perfect with every single cup. I love this item!
customer_reviews.author: A Leisure Moment

customer_reviews.title: Good for 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 9 months and now it just dribbles out a few drops. The water is in the tank but the coffee isn’t coming out :( I even cleaned it a week or two before it stopped working. When it did work, I had to watch the coffee pour, otherwise it might overflow the cup. You can’t see how much water is in the tank so I would just fill it, and stop the machine when I had enough coffee in my cup. One time I wasn’t watching and it just poured until all of the water in the tank was gone and made a mess. I think it’s time to buy a keurig.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It's not a brand name Keurig, but this works really well. I've used a bunch of small coffee pots as I travel for work. This little 1 cup brewer is great and makes a great cup of coffee. For the pricepoint, you really can't beat it. It's small size is another huge plus. It's so small, I may just travel with it in my suitcase given the Covid19 situation. I really am enjoying this little pot. Only negative thing to say is you have to guesstimate your water that you put in. A little side viewing window for the water level would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: dhc8

customer_reviews.title: Halfway brewer
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot would be perfect if it worked. We bought two, one for our rv and one for my shop office. They both do the same thing- quit dispensing before the reservoir is empty. They both stop when they’re about halfway through the brew which leaves about half a cup in the machine. If you push the button, it’ll brew a little more and you can repeat this step until it’s finally done. What a waste. Now that we’ve found this out it’s past the return window. Unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! I was initially going to get a small Keurig, but after reading the reviews I changed my mind and searched for something with better reviews. That’s when I found this guy. I keep one of those small glass Pyrex measuring cups in the cabinet above and use it to fill with water each morning, then pop in a K-cup and it’s ready to go. It doesn’t take long to start brewing and my coffee comes out perfect. I love that I can use regular K-cups with it.
customer_reviews.author: Maleigh3

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Keurig instead
customer_reviews.text: This product leaks like crazy. I tried less water, still leaks. My counter has more coffee on it than my cup did! I'm very disappointed as I haven't even had it a year. Great size to save space, coffee (when you can actually get enough in the cup) tastes great and it's easy to use. However, performance is sadly lacking. Brews very slowly. Throwing it in the garbage. Go with something else!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Denney Harris

customer_reviews.title: Best little coffee creation
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer. I love this coffee maker! It takes up such little space and works like a charm. I love the fact that I can use any coffee pod that I want. I can use Aldi brand or Starbucks pods too! The flavor tastes great and it is easy to clean and I love the fact that it turns off on its own because a lot of time I forget. I think it’s faster than the kureg and keeps my coffee super hot. I even make hot chocolate for my kids in it & they love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye future Keurigs!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS! I bought this for my 89 year old mom who is coming to stay for a few weeks, as an addition to her bedroom. Thought she could get up in morning and have her cup of coffee and get ready on her time. The side has three easy steps listed to follow. There is no mistake when the coffee is done. Any pods for Keurig fit perfect. I just bought a Keurig for my daughter over seas and wish I would have gotten this instead! It’s so darn cute, light weight but sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work! Great price! Perfect for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: A favorite purchase! I think everyone loves having their own favorite coffee, especially while traveling. When you’re away from home, coffee never tastes as good. This coffee maker is so small, it fits in my suitcase. It cleans up so easily. It works great. No need to spend a lot of money on room service coffee that never tastes the way you want it to. It is priced just right. I have saved so much money by purchasing this! I pack a few k-cups and off I go. Must buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Mahi

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 4 cups of coffee. Coffee comes out HOT!!! However the 5th cup of coffee I tried to make, that’s when the problem started. It seems the pump went out. It would only drip water. Thinking it was an error on my part I tried again and waisted anothe pod. Again it would only drip water. I even tried it with no pod in it and no luck. Nice little coffee maker except for the not wanting to make coffee part.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a small, cheap coffee maker for work. It works perfectly well and spits out the coffee in less than 3 minutes. My two dislikes is the coffee does not stay as hot as it would with an actual Keurig machine, and you can't see how much water you are pouring in if you're not measuring it. I normally use half a water bottle two times but I can't see the exact amount of ounces I am pouring in. Otherwise, I love it and hope it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works... sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago and am already having problems with it. It works fine for a few days, then inexplicably stops halfway through the heating cycle. At least our old Keurig worked for two years of everyday use before dying. I would recommend you spend the extra money and buy something sturdier and more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ceekay9

customer_reviews.title: The BEST little coffee maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how they did it, but they have created a single serve coffee maker that is better than Keurig, Hands Down!!! What a fabulous little find this is. When I had a Keurig I went through three of them in about two years. It took up a large space on the kitchen counter and produced a cup of coffee that didn't seem hot enough. This is awesome. It takes up a tiny portion of the counter and the coffee is hot. I love it. I love that you can fit a large coffee cup in the cup holder and that there is an auto shut off. Don't hesitate with this one. It has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this but...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this coffee maker, it seemed like a good deal for the price and most reviews were great but I've only had it a few weeks and twice it has leaked all over the place. I'm not overfilling the reservoir, if anything, I'm not even getting a whole cups worth. I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong but I'm not pleased with coffee leaking all over the place. I probably should have sprung a little more for a Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: Vivipoo

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED !!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. Purchased but did not use for months - it was a backup for the next time my Keurig stopped working, which it did 3 days ago. Hooked up Chulux and initially seemed ok. Now after 6 brewing cycles it will not dispense water from reservoir. Used filtered water. Took apart per manual to "clean". Nothing plugged. Tried 3 times running hot filtered water thru with no K-cup. Still drip, drip, drip a few drops with 95% of water never dispensed. To the trash it goes. I have no idea what brand of single-serve machines to try or trust. Suggestions appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great single-serve coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this machine for about 1 1/2 years. I love it! I use the Chulux reusable single-cup filters with it (they work great). If the machine appears to stop working (likely from mineral buildup), just run a mixture of 1/2 cup of white vinegar and 1/2 cup of water through the machine (you might have to repeatedly press the power button). I then run water through it a few times. Ideally it would be best to clean it this way on a regular basis. I now try to do this every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Sdia

customer_reviews.title: This does not work.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought one of these for my elderly friend, it stopped working after about a month. I thought perhaps it was a fluke, so I bought another one, since he liked it. Plugged it in, pressed the button, no power to the unit. Checked the outlet, which is fine. Tried it again and again. The second one didn't even work once. Amazon should not allow these kinds of products to be sold on its site. If you buy one, save all of the packaging, you will be sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Arcy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker based on the many positive reviews. I only used it in our camper on 2 separate occasions. The first camping trip, it worked fine. However, the second trip, it began to act up. After clicking the button to start the brewing, it would only fill about 1/5th of the coffee cup. I had to click the start button 4 more separate times to get a full cup. This continued to happen for the rest of the 2-week camping trip. It makes a good cup of coffee, but it's a big pain to have to keep clicking the start button. :(
customer_reviews.author: D. AtKinson

customer_reviews.title: For a quick clean cup of Joe on the go.
customer_reviews.text: The Chulux is chulaxly what I was looking for. Its a quick, easy, and clean alternative to brewing a medium cup of coffee. I still use my Bialetti moka to make tasty espressi, my French Press for dark rich coffees, and my Vietnameese coffee filter when I want something bitter but for day to day use the Chulux offers a medium brewed coffee that's a tasty daily dose of pep in a cup. You wont be able to get dark rich tones or savor a nice brew with crema, but for a quick medium brew, it is a cheap and cheerful alternative for a quick and clean cup of joe.
customer_reviews.author: Martin M. Elissetche

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this coffee maker for lone, about one month, but so far I am very happy with it, the amount of time to make a cup of coffee is excellent, I would rather it take adequate amount of time to heat the water before making the coffee than end up with a lukewarm cup of coffee. The is little noise when working. Have had no problems with overflowing. I do enjoy the color of the machine and how many choices they had to chose from.
customer_reviews.author: oneperson

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy with this compact coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like every time we stay at a hotel or lodge the coffee in the room is disgusting so thought we would look for a small travel type coffee maker of our own. Haven’t left town in awhile but have used this little machine every day for almost 2 months and it has worked perfectly. Absolutely no problems whatsoever. It’s small and compact so can easily carried in suitcase or other type travel bad. Wonderful for road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Smalles KCup you will find, works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME PRODUCT. Got this one specifically for the RV as it takes up far less space than the others on amazon. It works great with all Kcups. We feel it is better than the Real K brewer we have at home, so we are buying another for the house, since it is half the price of a real K brewer. I'd recommend it for any small spaces. Your Desk at work, RV, Tiny House, Mother-in-Law suite, efficiency kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: error[droptable]

customer_reviews.title: Camping Bliss!
customer_reviews.text: I know K-Cups are not great for the environment, but when using our travel trailer, we needed a small and effective coffee maker. I was looking for a small, single serve unit like you would find in a hotel room. This is AMAZING. We have a Keurig in our guest house and I really think this unit makes better coffee. The compact size makes it PERFECT for camping. It looks great, is reliable, makes great coffee and takes up very little room. The price is AMAZING. If you are looking for a great coffee maker for your college student, your office or any place where space is an issue, stop looking and press BUY NOW!
customer_reviews.author: Αριστείδης

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about two years, it is still working good. Sometimes the nozzle got stuck with coffee powder, but just have to clean it with a tooth pick then it will continue to work. Overall I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hsin-Cheng Chao

customer_reviews.title: Love the small size..
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a coffee maker from this company that had a different design. The switch quit working. I contacted the company and they took care of the problem quickly. I received a refund. I really like this small size so I decided to try a different design. The one I purchased has the switch on the side and so far no problems..it makes a great cup of coffee.. it brews slowly but worth the wait. Thank you to the company for their quick response and solution.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hayson

product_meta.title: CHULUX Single Serve Coffee Maker Brewer for Single Cup Capsule with 12 Ounce Reservoir,Black
feature_bullets: 【SINGLE CUP COFFEE BREWER-12OZ】CHULUX personal coffee maker fits 1.0 and 2.0 pod coffee capsules to meet your multiple favour.You also can use ground coffee (refillable filter NOT included),then create your private cafe at rushing hours or relax time.

【ONE BUTTON ON/OFF OPERATION】800W heating element with rapid brewing system.Our brewer with blue indicator light,also features auto shut-off preventing from overheating and keeping safe.One cup of delicous brewed coffee will ready for you just within 3mins.Also can use it as a water boiler to get hot water.

【LIGHTWEIGHT + TRAVEL SIZE】The compact design takes up tiny space and make this one cup brewer easy to carry anywhere,especially for business trip or vocation.It perfect for home,office,dormitory,small lounge,RV and ect.Only be used for 120V voltage.

【BUILT-IN RESERVOIR + REMOVABLE DRIP TRAY】The water amount you pour equal to coffee amount that comes out,ensure every fresh cup.Without any mess.The single brewer supports for standard size,or by removing drip tray for larger mug (up to 5.3" height).

【FOOD-APPROVED MATERIAL + EASY TO CLEAN】BPA-free material for water tank and piercing needle.Detachable filter basket and drip tray can be washed directly.Drip tray keep brew space neat and clean.For cleaning,just add water and vinegar and press button.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars12,270 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
